question:
Some people believe that children’s leisure activities must be educational, otherwise they
are a complete waste of time.
Do you agree or disagree?
Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your experience.
text: Education is extremely important for everyone. It plays a vital role in every lives. But sometimes it is also crucial to spend some time in extra curricular activities. It can be indoor or outdoor.

Pupils should be given a choice about what they want to do. Even adults have different interests, so does the children have. For instance, some like swimming, while others like golf, cricket, tennis, etc. Leisure activities should not be controlled by parents as that is the time to relax mentally and physically for a child after their studies.

One can learn various qualities from sports. For example, team building, negotiation, ‘never say die’ attitude. It also helps in improving social skills when you meet new people. All the skills help in later stages of life.

People who restrict children’s leisure activities to be completely educational should avoid doing so It can hamper a child’s progress, “All work and no play makes Jack a dull boy”. Therefore, a proper balance must be made between education and other leisure activities.

By involving a child in different activities such as drama, music, painting, meditation, yoga, one can make them fell positive and happier. This will also help them in widening their career choices as they can also become artists.

To put in a nutshell, children should be given freedom in choosing what they want to do in their free time. By this way, they can feel relaxed and gain energy for studying further. Moreover, extra curricular activities help in defining the personality of an individual.
